alert.note: Alert for Western Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 27 at 6:59PM AKST until December 28 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph with visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Shemya. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions, with heaviest snow and strongest winds, will be between 3pm and 9pm.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
